note: Real measurements - both systems actually run

this_poc.output: KV caching is a technique where frequently accessed key-value pairs are stored in a fast, in-memory cache to reduce latency and improve performance by avoiding slower data retrieval from the original data source.

lmstudio.output: KV (Key-Value) caching stores frequently accessed data as key-value pairs in a fast, readily available memory store to reduce latency and improve application performance by avoiding slower data retrieval processes.

lmstudio.note: No cache persistence - full processing each session
